subject: URGENT: Production API returning 500 errors - All services down
body:
We are experiencing a critical production outage. Starting at approximately 9:15 AM EST, all API calls to our production environment in us-east-1 are returning HTTP 500 Internal Server Error.

This is affecting ALL of our customers and we are losing revenue every minute this continues. Our entire platform depends on your API.

Error message from our logs:
"Error: HTTP 500 - Internal Server Error. Request ID: req_abc123xyz"

We have over 50,000 active users who cannot access our service right now. This is a P0 emergency.

Please escalate immediately and provide an ETA for resolution. We need someone on a call with us ASAP.

Environment: Production
Region: us-east-1
Impact: Complete service outage, revenue loss estimated at $10,000/hour

subject: Unexpected charge on January invoice - Need clarification
body:
Hi Support Team,

I just reviewed our January invoice (INV-2024-1234) and noticed an unexpected charge of $847.50 labeled as "API Overage Charges".

According to my understanding of our Professional plan, we should have 100,000 API calls included, and our dashboard shows we only used approximately 85,000 calls last month.

Can you please explain:
1. Why we were charged for overages when we didn't exceed our limit?
2. Provide a detailed breakdown of the usage that led to this charge?
3. If this is an error, how do we get a refund or credit?

I've attached a screenshot of our usage dashboard showing 85,247 calls for the billing period.

This is the second time we've had billing discrepancies in the past 6 months, so I'd appreciate a thorough review.

Thanks,
Michael

subject: Bug: Webhook payload missing timestamp field in staging
body:
Hello,

I've discovered a bug in the webhook payload structure when testing in our staging environment.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Configure a webhook endpoint in the dashboard
2. Trigger an event that should fire the webhook (I used 'user.created')
3. Inspect the received payload

Expected behavior:
The webhook payload should include a 'timestamp' field as documented in your API docs (https://docs.example.com/webhooks#payload-structure)

Actual behavior:
The 'timestamp' field is missing from the payload. All other fields are present.

Example received payload:
{
  "event": "user.created",
  "data": {
    "user_id": "usr_123",
    "email": "test@example.com"
  }
}

Expected payload (per docs):
{
  "event": "user.created",
  "timestamp": "2024-01-15T16:25:00Z",
  "data": {
    "user_id": "usr_123",
    "email": "test@example.com"
  }
}

Environment: Staging
API Version: v2
Webhook endpoint: https://staging.devshop.dev/webhooks/receiver

This isn't blocking us since we're still in development, but we'd like to know if this is a known issue and when it might be fixed.

Thanks!
